intro: Hedeoma mandoniana, commonly known as the Mexican mint marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, mint-scented leaves and small yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. Hedeoma mandoniana is also cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and fragrance.
